name: Record of Location of Aerial Bombs — Manchester (1940–41)
description: 49 annotated OS map sheets recording bomb damage during the Manchester Blitz. Fire bombs (red dots), high explosives (blue dots), line mines (green dots). Red shading = demolished; pink = damaged but standing.
notes:
49 items (1 index + 48 map sheets). IIIF via LUNA (University of Manchester).
Ref: GB127.MISC/1192/1. LUNA collection: maps002~1~1
Base on OS Revisions 1932-35 at 1:2500 scale.
IIIF manifest pattern: https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/iiif/m/maps002~1~1~{ID1}~{ID2}/manifest
IIIF image pattern: https://luna.manchester.ac.uk/luna/servlet/iiif/maps002~1~1~{ID1}~{ID2}

Sheets by OS grid:
  Index: 337981~123243
  Sheet 96: pts 6,7,10,11,12,14,15,16 (IDs 342440~123244 through 342531~123251)
  Sheet 97: pt 13 (342544~123252)
  Sheet 104: pts 2,3,4,6,7,8,10,11,12,14,15,16 (342557~123253 through 342713~123265)
  Sheet 104 composite (pts 6+7+10+11): 351132~123655 (city centre)
  Sheet 105: pts 9,13 (342674~123262, 342726~123266)
  Sheet 110: pts 12,16 (342843~123275, 342895~123279)
  Sheet 111: pts 1-11,13-15 (342739~123267 through 342934~123282)
  Sheet 111A: pts 1,2,3,5,6,7,10,11 (342947~123283 through 343038~123290)

Fire bombs = red dots, HE = blue dots, line mines = green dots.
Red shading = demolished, pink = damaged but standing.
Christmas Blitz 22-24 Dec 1940 killed ~684 people.

Also on Flickr: https://www.flickr.com/photos/manchesterarchiveplus/8255052692
Not seen in public for 60 years before digitization by CHICC.
UoM Georeferencer: https://manchester.oldmapsonline.org/
No AllMaps annotations yet — needs manual georeferencing.
